<Link id="l00001" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//===- GuardWidening.cpp - ---- Guard widening ----------------------------===//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00002" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00003" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Part of the LLVM Project, under the Apache License v2.0 with LLVM Exceptions.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00004" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// See https://llvm.org/LICENSE.txt for license information.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00005" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// SPDX-License-Identifier: Apache-2.0 WITH LLVM-exception</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00006" /><CodeLine lineNumber="6"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00007" /><CodeLine lineNumber="7"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00008" /><CodeLine lineNumber="8"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00009" /><CodeLine lineNumber="9"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This file implements the guard widening pass.  The semantics of the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00010" /><CodeLine lineNumber="10"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// @llvm.experimental.guard intrinsic lets LLVM transform it so that it fails</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00011" /><CodeLine lineNumber="11"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// more often that it did before the transform.  This optimization is called</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00012" /><CodeLine lineNumber="12"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// &quot;widening&quot; and can be used hoist and common runtime checks in situations like</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00013" /><CodeLine lineNumber="13"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// these:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00014" /><CodeLine lineNumber="14"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00015" /><CodeLine lineNumber="15"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    %cmp0 = 7 u&lt; Length</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00016" /><CodeLine lineNumber="16"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    call @llvm.experimental.guard(i1 %cmp0) &#91; &quot;deopt&quot;(...) &#93;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00017" /><CodeLine lineNumber="17"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    call @unknown&#95;side&#95;effects()</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00018" /><CodeLine lineNumber="18"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    %cmp1 = 9 u&lt; Length</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00019" /><CodeLine lineNumber="19"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    call @llvm.experimental.guard(i1 %cmp1) &#91; &quot;deopt&quot;(...) &#93;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00020" /><CodeLine lineNumber="20"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    ...</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00021" /><CodeLine lineNumber="21"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00022" /><CodeLine lineNumber="22"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// =&gt;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00023" /><CodeLine lineNumber="23"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00024" /><CodeLine lineNumber="24"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    %cmp0 = 9 u&lt; Length</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00025" /><CodeLine lineNumber="25"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    call @llvm.experimental.guard(i1 %cmp0) &#91; &quot;deopt&quot;(...) &#93;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00026" /><CodeLine lineNumber="26"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    call @unknown&#95;side&#95;effects()</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00027" /><CodeLine lineNumber="27"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    ...</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00028" /><CodeLine lineNumber="28"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00029" /><CodeLine lineNumber="29"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// If %cmp0 is false, @llvm.experimental.guard will &quot;deoptimize&quot; back to a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00030" /><CodeLine lineNumber="30"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// generic implementation of the same function, which will have the correct</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00031" /><CodeLine lineNumber="31"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// semantics from that point onward.  It is always &#95;legal&#95; to deoptimize (so</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00032" /><CodeLine lineNumber="32"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// replacing %cmp0 with false is &quot;correct&quot;), though it may not always be</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00033" /><CodeLine lineNumber="33"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// profitable to do so.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00034" /><CodeLine lineNumber="34"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00035" /><CodeLine lineNumber="35"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// NB! This pass is a work in progress.  It hasn&#39;t been tuned to be &quot;production</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00036" /><CodeLine lineNumber="36"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// ready&quot; yet.  It is known to have quadriatic running time and will not scale</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00037" /><CodeLine lineNumber="37"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// to large numbers of guards</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00038" /><CodeLine lineNumber="38"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00039" /><CodeLine lineNumber="39"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00040" /><CodeLine lineNumber="40"></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00115" /><CodeLine lineNumber="115"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Find a point at which the widened condition of \\p Guard should be inserted.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00116" /><CodeLine lineNumber="116"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// When it is represented as intrinsic call, we can do it right before the call</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00117" /><CodeLine lineNumber="117"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// instruction. However, when we are dealing with widenable branch, we must</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00118" /><CodeLine lineNumber="118"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// account for the following situation: widening should not turn a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00119" /><CodeLine lineNumber="119"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// loop-invariant condition into a loop-variant. It means that if</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00120" /><CodeLine lineNumber="120"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// widenable.condition() call is invariant (w.r.t. any loop), the new wide</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00121" /><CodeLine lineNumber="121"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// condition should stay invariant. Otherwise there can be a miscompile, like</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00122" /><CodeLine lineNumber="122"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// the one described at https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project/issues/60234. The</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00123" /><CodeLine lineNumber="123"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// safest way to do it is to expand the new condition at WC&#39;s block.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00124" /><CodeLine lineNumber="124"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">static</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> std::optional&lt;BasicBlock::iterator&gt;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00125" /><CodeLine lineNumber="125" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/anonymous-guardwidening-cpp-/#a0d69c80bfa592d9ac6901fa22f7ff405"><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/namespaces/anonymous-guardwidening-cpp-/#a0d69c80bfa592d9ac6901fa22f7ff405">findInsertionPointForWideCondition</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &#42;WCOrGuard) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00126" /><CodeLine lineNumber="126"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a656efdcee3deb029763304d3e741a2d1">isGuard</a>(WCOrGuard))</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00162" /><CodeLine lineNumber="162"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Used to keep track of which widening potential is more effective.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00163" /><CodeLine lineNumber="163"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">enum</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> WideningScore &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00164" /><CodeLine lineNumber="164"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// Don&#39;t widen.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00165" /><CodeLine lineNumber="165"><span class="doxyHighlight">    WS&#95;IllegalOrNegative,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00166" /><CodeLine lineNumber="166"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00167" /><CodeLine lineNumber="167"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// Widening is performance neutral as far as the cycles spent in check</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00168" /><CodeLine lineNumber="168"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// conditions goes (but can still help, e.g., code layout, having less</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00169" /><CodeLine lineNumber="169"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// deopt state).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00170" /><CodeLine lineNumber="170"><span class="doxyHighlight">    WS&#95;Neutral,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00171" /><CodeLine lineNumber="171"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00172" /><CodeLine lineNumber="172"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// Widening is profitable.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00173" /><CodeLine lineNumber="173"><span class="doxyHighlight">    WS&#95;Positive,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00174" /><CodeLine lineNumber="174"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00175" /><CodeLine lineNumber="175"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// Widening is very profitable.  Not significantly different from \\c</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00176" /><CodeLine lineNumber="176"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// WS&#95;Positive, except by the order.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00177" /><CodeLine lineNumber="177"><span class="doxyHighlight">    WS&#95;VeryPositive</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00178" /><CodeLine lineNumber="178"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00179" /><CodeLine lineNumber="179"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00180" /><CodeLine lineNumber="180"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">static</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> scoreTypeToString(WideningScore WS);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00181" /><CodeLine lineNumber="181"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00182" /><CodeLine lineNumber="182"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Compute the score for widening the condition in \\p DominatedInstr</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00184" /><CodeLine lineNumber="184"><span class="doxyHighlight">  WideningScore computeWideningScore(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &#42;DominatedInstr,</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00186" /><CodeLine lineNumber="186"><span class="doxyHighlight">                                     <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/basicblock/#a98c0a84a5dfa8bce341c829709f171e5">BasicBlock::iterator</a> WideningPoint,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00187" /><CodeLine lineNumber="187"><span class="doxyHighlight">                                     <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl&lt;Value &#42;&gt;</a> &amp;ChecksToHoist,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00188" /><CodeLine lineNumber="188"><span class="doxyHighlight">                                     <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl&lt;Value &#42;&gt;</a> &amp;ChecksToWiden);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00189" /><CodeLine lineNumber="189"></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00485" /><CodeLine lineNumber="485"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// If the guard was conditional executed, it may never be reached</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00486" /><CodeLine lineNumber="486"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// dynamically.  There are two potential downsides to hoisting it out of the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00487" /><CodeLine lineNumber="487"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// conditionally executed region: 1) we may spuriously deopt without need and</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00488" /><CodeLine lineNumber="488"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// 2) we have the extra cost of computing the guard condition in the common</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00489" /><CodeLine lineNumber="489"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// case.  At the moment, we really only consider the second in our heuristic</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00490" /><CodeLine lineNumber="490"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// here.  TODO: evaluate cost model for spurious deopt</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00491" /><CodeLine lineNumber="491"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// NOTE: As written, this also lets us hoist right over another guard which</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00492" /><CodeLine lineNumber="492"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// is essentially just another spelling for control flow.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00493" /><CodeLine lineNumber="493"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (isWideningCondProfitable(ChecksToHoist, ChecksToWiden))</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00498" /><CodeLine lineNumber="498"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00499" /><CodeLine lineNumber="499"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// For a given basic block \\p BB, return its successor which is guaranteed or</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00500" /><CodeLine lineNumber="500"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// highly likely will be taken as its successor.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00501" /><CodeLine lineNumber="501"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">auto</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> GetLikelySuccessor = &#91;&#93;(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/basicblock">BasicBlock</a> &#42; BB)-&gt;</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/basicblock">BasicBlock</a> &#42; &#123;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00503" /><CodeLine lineNumber="503"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> UniqueSucc;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00504" /><CodeLine lineNumber="504"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">auto</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/m68kbeads/#abf9ad6053d17fcef3b68af71aa681944a27d0e059322508a76f918503800ef1bd">Term</a> = BB-&gt;getTerminator();</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00505" /><CodeLine lineNumber="505"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/riscv/riscvredundantcopyelimination-cpp/#a193847098793cdbab306803186676899">Cond</a> = </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">nullptr</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00520" /><CodeLine lineNumber="520"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// branches?</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00521" /><CodeLine lineNumber="521"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">nullptr</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00522" /><CodeLine lineNumber="522"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00523" /><CodeLine lineNumber="523"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00524" /><CodeLine lineNumber="524"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Returns true if we might be hoisting above explicit control flow into a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00525" /><CodeLine lineNumber="525"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// considerably hotter block.  Note that this completely ignores implicit</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00526" /><CodeLine lineNumber="526"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// control flow (guards, calls which throw, etc...).  That choice appears</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00527" /><CodeLine lineNumber="527"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// arbitrary (we assume that implicit control flow exits are all rare).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00528" /><CodeLine lineNumber="528"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">auto</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> MaybeHoistingToHotterBlock = &#91;&amp;&#93;() &#123;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00530" /><CodeLine lineNumber="530"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">auto</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &#42;DominatedBlock = DominatedInstr-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/ilist-detail/node-parent-access/#a7e19e7508415378ad9523e0339b23e22">getParent</a>();</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00531" /><CodeLine lineNumber="531"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00532" /><CodeLine lineNumber="532"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Descend as low as we can, always taking the likely successor.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00533" /><CodeLine lineNumber="533"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/silowercontrolflow-cpp/#a4868c5d81c5ccc98c47aeab6244346a0">assert</a>(DT.isReachableFromEntry(DominatingBlock) &amp;&amp; </span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;Unreached code&quot;</span><span class="doxyHighlight">);</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00538" /><CodeLine lineNumber="538"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// No likely successor?</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00539" /><CodeLine lineNumber="539"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (!LikelySucc)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00540" /><CodeLine lineNumber="540"><span class="doxyHighlight">        </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">break</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00541" /><CodeLine lineNumber="541"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Only go down the dominator tree.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00542" /><CodeLine lineNumber="542"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (!DT.properlyDominates(DominatingBlock, LikelySucc))</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00545" /><CodeLine lineNumber="545"><span class="doxyHighlight">    &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00546" /><CodeLine lineNumber="546"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00547" /><CodeLine lineNumber="547"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Found?</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00548" /><CodeLine lineNumber="548"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (DominatedBlock == DominatingBlock)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00549" /><CodeLine lineNumber="549"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">false</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00550" /><CodeLine lineNumber="550"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// We followed the likely successor chain and went past the dominated</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00551" /><CodeLine lineNumber="551"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// block. It means that the dominated guard is in dead/very cold code.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00911" /><CodeLine lineNumber="911"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint">APInt</a> &amp;HighOffset = MaxOffset-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/constantint/#af7e1934ed72a405ef073ea5f9bbe828e">getValue</a>();</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00912" /><CodeLine lineNumber="912"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">auto</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> OffsetOK = &#91;&amp;&#93;(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> GuardWideningImpl::RangeCheck &amp;RC) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00913" /><CodeLine lineNumber="913"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (HighOffset - RC.getOffsetValue()).ult(MaxDiff);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00914" /><CodeLine lineNumber="914"><span class="doxyHighlight">    &#125;;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00915" /><CodeLine lineNumber="915"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00916" /><CodeLine lineNumber="916"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (MaxDiff.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint/#a60dd597765e178719e8d4caf44ba3b64">isMinValue</a>() || !<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a0d10fe510ced2849a8074fe81e5d04ce">all&#95;of</a>(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a02981de53fb6ffd384d39addc4d25f37">drop&#95;begin</a>(CurrentChecks), OffsetOK))</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00917" /><CodeLine lineNumber="917"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">false</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00918" /><CodeLine lineNumber="918"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00919" /><CodeLine lineNumber="919"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// We have a series of f+1 checks as:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00920" /><CodeLine lineNumber="920"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00921" /><CodeLine lineNumber="921"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   I+k&#95;0 u&lt; L   ... Chk&#95;0</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00922" /><CodeLine lineNumber="922"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   I+k&#95;1 u&lt; L   ... Chk&#95;1</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00923" /><CodeLine lineNumber="923"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   ...</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00924" /><CodeLine lineNumber="924"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   I+k&#95;f u&lt; L   ... Chk&#95;f</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00925" /><CodeLine lineNumber="925"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00926" /><CodeLine lineNumber="926"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     with forall i in &#91;0,f&#93;: k&#95;f-k&#95;i u&lt; k&#95;f-k&#95;0  ... Precond&#95;0</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00927" /><CodeLine lineNumber="927"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//          k&#95;f-k&#95;0 u&lt; INT&#95;MIN+k&#95;f                 ... Precond&#95;1</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00928" /><CodeLine lineNumber="928"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//          k&#95;f != k&#95;0                             ... Precond&#95;2</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00929" /><CodeLine lineNumber="929"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00930" /><CodeLine lineNumber="930"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Claim:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00931" /><CodeLine lineNumber="931"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   Chk&#95;0 AND Chk&#95;f  implies all the other checks</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00932" /><CodeLine lineNumber="932"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00933" /><CodeLine lineNumber="933"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Informal proof sketch:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00934" /><CodeLine lineNumber="934"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00935" /><CodeLine lineNumber="935"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// We will show that the integer range &#91;I+k&#95;0,I+k&#95;f&#93; does not unsigned-wrap</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00936" /><CodeLine lineNumber="936"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// (i.e. going from I+k&#95;0 to I+k&#95;f does not cross the -1,0 boundary) and</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00937" /><CodeLine lineNumber="937"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// thus I+k&#95;f is the greatest unsigned value in that range.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00938" /><CodeLine lineNumber="938"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00939" /><CodeLine lineNumber="939"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This combined with Ckh&#95;(f+1) shows that everything in that range is u&lt; L.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00940" /><CodeLine lineNumber="940"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Via Precond&#95;0 we know that all of the indices in Chk&#95;0 through Chk&#95;(f+1)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00941" /><CodeLine lineNumber="941"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// lie in &#91;I+k&#95;0,I+k&#95;f&#93;, this proving our claim.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00942" /><CodeLine lineNumber="942"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00943" /><CodeLine lineNumber="943"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// To see that &#91;I+k&#95;0,I+k&#95;f&#93; is not a wrapping range, note that there are</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00944" /><CodeLine lineNumber="944"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// two possibilities: I+k&#95;0 u&lt; I+k&#95;f or I+k&#95;0 &gt;u I+k&#95;f (they can&#39;t be equal</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00945" /><CodeLine lineNumber="945"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// since k&#95;0 != k&#95;f).  In the former case, &#91;I+k&#95;0,I+k&#95;f&#93; is not a wrapping</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00946" /><CodeLine lineNumber="946"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// range by definition, and the latter case is impossible:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00947" /><CodeLine lineNumber="947"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00948" /><CodeLine lineNumber="948"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   0-----I+k&#95;f---I+k&#95;0----L---INT&#95;MAX,INT&#95;MIN------------------(-1)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00949" /><CodeLine lineNumber="949"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   xxxxxx             xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00950" /><CodeLine lineNumber="950"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00951" /><CodeLine lineNumber="951"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// For Chk&#95;0 to succeed, we&#39;d have to have k&#95;f-k&#95;0 (the range highlighted</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00952" /><CodeLine lineNumber="952"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// with &#39;x&#39; above) to be at least &gt;u INT&#95;MIN.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00953" /><CodeLine lineNumber="953"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00954" /><CodeLine lineNumber="954"><span class="doxyHighlight">    RangeChecksOut.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl/#a396fcfee6914c76974b73c3d203da6a5">emplace&#95;back</a>(CurrentChecks.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectortemplatecommon/#a58dc840fc84420b7f0b773794b8101c1">front</a>());</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00955" /><CodeLine lineNumber="955"><span class="doxyHighlight">    RangeChecksOut.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl/#a396fcfee6914c76974b73c3d203da6a5">emplace&#95;back</a>(CurrentChecks.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectortemplatecommon/#acd9e771a3296c6b24146955754620557">back</a>());</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00956" /><CodeLine lineNumber="956"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00957" /><CodeLine lineNumber="957"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00958" /><CodeLine lineNumber="958"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/silowercontrolflow-cpp/#a4868c5d81c5ccc98c47aeab6244346a0">assert</a>(RangeChecksOut.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectortemplatecommon/#a1c479a8c434377c2b8cb056bdfdfc201">size</a>() &lt;= OldCount &amp;&amp; </span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;We pessimized!&quot;</span><span class="doxyHighlight">);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00959" /><CodeLine lineNumber="959"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> RangeChecksOut.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectortemplatecommon/#a1c479a8c434377c2b8cb056bdfdfc201">size</a>() != OldCount;</span></CodeLine>
